In his letter,  Mike Pence  said that throughout his life, "I have learned to follow my heart, and my heart is in Indiana.""  He praised the state's people, its  highways and byways, the small towns and courthouse squares, the big cities and cornfields.  "After years of falling behind, Indiana is on the verge of an era of growth and opportunity like no other time in my life,""  he wrote. "Those of us who serve

Star Press  MUNCIE, Ind.-- U.S.  Mike Pence  discussed his political future-- in somewhat nonspecific terms-- while addressing students in a Central High School social studies class Friday.  Mike Pence  acknowledged he was considering  maybe coming home and running for governor,  but the Republican said he was likely months away from making a final decision.
